page.title: 16Haltwhistle Library
page.content: The Library is on the main street and is open for part of each day except Wednesday and Sunday. When the librarian has her summer holiday it is closed for two weeks but we are allowed to take double the normal number of books out. On a wet day it is a warm, comfortable place to be. There are armchairs to sit on and games such as chess and dominoes to play. We can read the magazines and books that we are not allowed to take away. There is a BBC computer. The librarian likes us to be there so long as we behave ourselves. For very young children there are some tiny chairs and a low unit for books. Sometimes they get excited and shout out loud. If you enjoy listening to music you can borrow records. Local groups take turns to put up displays.
